rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Class consciousness and television
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The ‘television’ debate mirrors theoretical controversy over the conceptualization of capitalism’s social structure. Contemporary argument has revolved around three poles: were media exerting little social effect, exerting total ideological control, or constituting one among a few ‘socialization’ agents within society, but pre-formed values. However, the adoption of a class analysis leads to certain radical conclusions.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Political Science
